resource.chars:
2. hours time, the other half an hour after : the flesh 
of both was turn’d quite black as if mortifyed; 
the blood was coagulated & lookt black.
On the 3d. The Man’s Arm remained swelled, lookt 
red marbled with spots of yellow, but felt soft 
& he had ye perfect use of it & even of his fingers,
no pain or stiffness being left. He then caused a 
small Spannel Dog to be bit on ye Nose by a 
fresh Viper: <s>the Remedy<\s> some <s>warm<\s> oil was immediately applyed 
hot, & rubbed well in, till all ye hair of his Nose 
was thoro’ly wet: the Dog did not seem <s>much <\s> 
very uneasy; his nose only swelled a little; he 
eat soon after; his nose was bathed once more 
that evening, he was found very well next morning 
but his nose was bathed again to make sure of his 
cure; he remain’d perfectly well without any 
symptoms ensuing & was <s>well <\s> alive & well a year after.
Another pidgeon was likewise bit under the 
Wing at ye same time as ye Dog but by a fresh viper
the <s>Remedy <\s> oil was immediately applyed hot & rubbed 
well in, & ye feathers of the wing were thoro’ly 
wetted with it. This Bird did not seem at all dis 
order’d with ye venom, but eat soon after, & was 
found well ye next morning without any re-
markable Inflammation or swelling about the 
part: the <s>Remedy <\s> hot oil was rubbed in again for 2 or 
3 days twice a day & the bird continued well
